page.title: 14DALTON VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: The Hall belongs to the Church Council, but is leased to the Village Hall Committee for 99 years at Â£5.00 per year rent. Originally the Hall was the local school house but became a dwelling house. After the Second World War it was converted into a Hall, where Communion was held monthly, and where other local activities took place. Now the Hall is used by the W.I. for their monthly meetings on the first Tuesday in the month. There are Parish Council meetings held in the Hall once every two months. Each year a Harvest Festival is held there, and a Carol Service is arranged each Christmas by the Tidy Village Committee. The Hall is also used for childrens' parties, and by a musical group for rehearsals.
